title: About
text:
I am a sophomore at Pomona College intending to double major in Economics and Math, while also pursuing a minor in Data Science. I am also on the Pomona College swim team. I have been working on my data analysis skills and learning R. I have worked on several TidyTuesday datasets to create visuals.
Check out the Data Viz tab on the top left to check out some interesting data visuals.

title: Ian’s Project Website
text:
Welcome to my website! Click the links down below for more information.
Biography: I am a sophomore at Pomona College intending to double major in Economics and Math, while also pursuing a minor in Data Science. I am also on the Pomona College swim team. I am originally from the San Francisco East Bay Area.

title: Lisa Vegetable Garden
text:
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 22)

harvest_2020 <- tuesdata$harvest_2020
harvest_2021 <- tuesdata$harvest_2021
planting_2020 <- tuesdata$planting_2020
planting_2021 <- tuesdata$planting_2021
spending_2020 <- tuesdata$spending_2020
spending_2021 <- tuesdata$spending_2021

Below you can see my code and data visualization of Lisa’s Vegetable Garden. The graph represents the average weight of vegetables harvested during each month of the 2020 harvest.

library(tidyverse)


harvest_2020_avg <- harvest_2020 |>
  mutate(month = as.Date(format(as.Date(date), "%Y-%m-01"))) |>  # Extract month and convert to Date format
  group_by(month) |>
  summarize(avg_weight = mean(weight, na.rm = TRUE))

ggplot(harvest_2020_avg, aes(x = month, y = avg_weight)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Average Weight of Vegetables Harvested per Month in 2020 Season",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Average Weight (grams)")

title: Carbon Emissions
text:
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 21)

emissions <- tuesdata$emissions

Below you can see my code and data visualization of Carbon Emissions overtime in America. The graph shows the increase in Carbon Emissions from 1850-Present Day.

library(tidyverse)


summary_data <- emissions |>
  select(year, total_emissions_MtCO2e) |>
  group_by(year) |>
  summarize(ave_emissions = mean(total_emissions_MtCO2e))

ggplot(summary_data, aes(x = year, y = ave_emissions)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE) +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Average Carbon Emissions",
    title = "Total Carbon Emissions per Year"
  )

`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'
